item.title: Beast mode
item.description:
My dog just bit me. It hurt, but not that much. I am really indifferent to this incident. My friend and his dog were here some time ago, and they were playing with her favorite balls. I tried to grab my dog and move her away from them, but she bit me.

My project is advancing really well. I have been a freelancer for almost all of my working years, and one thing I’ve noticed is that it is really detrimental to my personal growth.

item.title: Locking in
item.description:
I think I am becoming much better at my new routine, which includes reading books, listening to podcasts, and conversing with native English speakers.

It is a habit of mine to come up with a solution for solving multiple problems. I am used to killing multiple birds with only one stone; hell, as long as I am locked in, even half a stone is enough.

If I had to make an example, I would narrate to you my life. But let us not go down that road.

item.title: A purely Machiavellian day
item.description:
My dog just stole my underwear, not the one that is on me, she grabbed it from somewhere in the house. Since I am not a tidy person, anything can be found anywhere.

My friend, who happens to be my neighbor, came by two hours ago, we talked for an hour and a half, about our problems, ambitions, life plans and past dramas.

I enjoy my conversations with him very much. He is not the only person whom I openly discuss my Machiavellian ideas with, but he is the only one who understands my schemes and the reasons behind them.

item.title: Testing github actions
item.description:
After almost two hours of playing with GitHub Actions and hugo config files, I managed to host my blog on GitHub pages appropriately.

They made it so easy, I just used a project called hugo to build the very thing you are looking at, for free.

I am also hosting this website for free, it is static and allows no user interactions yes, but it meets my needs, and is free.

item.title: My very first post
item.description:
I remember when I was kid , when I was at most 15 years old, I created a weblog for myself. I was so hyped over it, I was thinking, I’m going to get so many viewers…

And I didn’t. üêè

Past-me would condemn me for not achieving that, but Present-me doesn’t even care, really, not in the slightest.

It is really weird how people change over the course of time, people can change so much, that they can become the opposite of what they once were.
